description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4rdn8","text":"A protein roadblock forms when a protein binds DNA and hinders translocation of other DNA binding proteins. These roadblocks can have significant effects on gene expression and regulation as well as DNA binding. Experimental methods for studying the effects of such roadblocks often target endogenous sites or introduce non-variable specific sites into DNAs to create binding sites for artificially introduced protein roadblocks. In this work, we describe a method to create programmable roadblocks using dCas9, a cleavage deficient mutant of the CRISPR effector nuclease Cas9. The programmability allows us to custom design target sites in a synthetic gene intended for in vitro studies. These target sites can be coded with multivalency—in our case, internal restriction sites which can be used in validation studies to verify complete binding of the roadblock. We provide full protocols and sequences and demonstrate how to use the internal restriction sites to verify complete binding of the roadblock. We also provide example results of the effect of DNA roadblocks on the translocation of the restriction endonuclease NdeI, which searches for its cognate site using one dimensional diffusion along DNA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":671,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f77oh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62pfb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3a3gn","text":"Gather the materials used in Step 14 (See Materials section). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ma4n","text":"Thaw EnGen 2X sgRNA Reaction Mix, S. pyogenes, and the customer-supplied target-specific oligo (1 µM). Mix and pulse each component in microfuge prior to use for 10 seconds. Store enzyme mix on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":34,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bg21","text":"Assemble the reaction at room temperature in the order listed below. Add the enzyme last to each reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vclo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6ahe","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e7fog","text":"","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0":{"0":"A"},"1":{"0":"_"},"2":{"0":"7"},"A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"},"A_3":{"className":" "},"A_7":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"},"B_7":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["100","100"],"data":[["Reagent","Amount"],["Nuclease-free Water","2 μL"],["EnGen 2X sgRNA Reaction Mix, S. pyogenes","10 μL"],["Target-specific DNA oligo (1 µM) ","5 μL"],["DTT (0.1 M)","1 μL"],["EnGen sgRNA Enzyme Mix","2 μL"],["Total Volume","20 μL"]],"guid":"D7F816104B1111EC8EBB79AB2C6D1AEB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"erje8","text":"Table 4: EnGen 2X sgRNA Reaction Mix","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Amount"],["Nuclease-free Water","2 μL"],["EnGen 2X sgRNA Reaction Mix, S. pyogenes","10 μL"],["Target-specific DNA oligo (1 µM) ","5 μL"],["DTT (0.1 M)","1 μL"],["EnGen sgRNA Enzyme Mix","2 μL"],["Total Volume","20 μL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3s2eb","text":"Transfer reaction to ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vjcs","text":"Mix thoroughly and pulse-spin in a microfuge for 10 seconds. Incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5eu9q","text":"For DNase treatment, bring volume to 50 µL by adding 30 µL of nuclease-free water. Add 2 µL of DNase I, mix and incubate at 37°C for 15 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d7m1v","text":"Gather the materials used in Step 20 (See Materials section). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Ensure that ethanol has been added to the correct buffer. steps.section: Activation of dCas9 and Binding to DNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3tgqr","text":"Assemble the reaction below, in order, at room temperature. The final concentration of both the dCas9 and sgRNA should be 60 nM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"834kk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm889","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aivir","text":"","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"},"A_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"},"B_2":{"className":" "},"B_6":{"className":"_dt-h-center _dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Reagent ","Amount"],["Nuclease-free Water","19.14 µL"],["NEBuffer 3.1","3 μL"],["500 nM sgRNA","3.24 µL"],["1 µM dCas9,   S. pyogenes ","1.62 µL"],["Total Volume","27 μL"]],"guid":"6A3F11704B1411EC8EBB79AB2C6D1AEB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a2are","text":"Table 5: dCas9 System Reaction Mix","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent ","Amount"],["Nuclease-free Water","19.14 µL"],["NEBuffer 3.1","3 μL"],["500 nM sgRNA","3.24 µL"],["1 µM dCas9,   S. pyogenes ","1.62 µL"],["Total Volume","27 μL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Activation of dCas9 and Binding to DNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ai08g","text":"Mix thoroughly by pipetting mixture up and down gently. Pulse-spin in a microfuge. Incubate at 25°C for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Activation of dCas9 and Binding to DNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a8glc","text":"Mix thoroughly by pipetting mixture up and down gently. Pulse-spin in a microfuge. Incubate at 37°C for 15 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cie7c","text":"Add enough glycerol to tube so that it is equal to total reaction volume. Mix thoroughly by pipetting mixture up and down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eeua8","text":"    - Ex. Add 28.12 µL glycerol to 28.12 µL reaction mixture","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Activation of dCas9 and Binding to DNA

Add 1.12 µL of 75 nM stock DNA to reaction tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Make sure pure ethanol (200 Proof) has been added to the correct buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fon49","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8bj6","text":"For 1x volume (50 uL total), you must use a blank centrifuge tube with water to counterbalance the spin column.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kti3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7aot","text":"For 2x volume (100 uL total), use two spin columns and add 50 uL to each column.  This will produce the same concentration as 1x protocol, but twice the volume (2x the amount of DNA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsojo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fref","text":"For 4x volume (200 uL total), use two spin columns and add 100 uL (two PCR tubes) to each column.  This will produce twice the concentration of the 1x protocol, and twice the volume (4x the amount of DNA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46f9q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fd67q","text":"Store on ice after purification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"18rl4","text":"Gather the materials used in Step 8 (See Materials section). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2g9s0","text":"Collect concentrations 2 times each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7bii1","text":"Blank with Buffer EB or dd H2O, depending on how you elute in your PCR purification kit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"47nua","text":"Use a nanodrop or similar UV absorbance instrument for measurements.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"170eb","text":"Take the average of your 2 readings for each DNA sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4702q","text":"Convert ng/uL to nM using the formula below.  Record both ng/uL and nM numbers. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4foff","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nkjg","text":"Concentration [nM] = 1.62 × Concentration [ng/uL]  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Activation of dCas9 and Binding to DNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3qskr","text":"Thaw NEBuffer 3.1, 500 nM sgRNA, and 1 µM dCas9. Mix and pulse each component in microfuge prior to use. Store tubes on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Activation of dCas9 and Binding to DNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"drld7","text":"Roadblocks are now bound to programmed sites on DNA. Store in freezer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: sgRNA Synthesis & CRISPR-Cas9 Synthesis
